Body: A week ago, I flashed my Nexus S 4g with a custom kernel (Matrix) and ROM (CWM9). On reboot, my NS4G always bootloops, stuck on bootloader loading screen, and never gets to the Android System. It had the same result when I tried to flash it back to a stock ROM.I removed the battery, put it again and tried to boot into recovery to use adb to check my SD card content with parted (I think there was a problem on partition). In parted I can reformat it using adb or recovery, but its content couldn't be changed. I think there was a problem with NAND flash.Is there any way that I could Reformat NAND flash to fresh state?
Title: How to fix bad sector on NAND Flash Memory

history.Text: I have no idea with my Nexus S 4g now. A week ago, I flash my NS4G (Nexus S 4g) with custom kernel (Matrix) & ROM (CWM9). On reboot, my NS4G always have a bootloop, stuck on bootloader loading screen, and never get to Android System. It had the same result when I try to flash it on stock ROM. Then, I remove NS4G battery, put it again and try to boot on recovery to using adb to check my sd card content with parted (I think there was a problem on partition). on parted, I can reformat it using adb or recovery, but It's content couldn't be changed. I think there was a problem with NAND Flash.Is there any ways that I could Reformat NAND Flash to fresh state? Or maybe anyone in here has the same problem with me..? :'(
Nexus S 4G, How to fix bad sector on NAND Flash Memory
